item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, March 6, 2025 at 4:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: CodeTracer – A new time-traveling debugger implemented in Nim and Rust (95 points | 14 comments)
2. Age and cognitive skills: Use it or lose it (294 points | 159 comments)
3. Revolt: Open-Source Alternative to Discord (378 points | 274 comments)
4. On the criteria to be used in decomposing systems into modules (1972) (47 points | 4 comments)
5. Beavers Are Coming Home (42 points | 26 comments)
6. Launch HN: Cenote (YC W25) – Back Office Automation for Medical Clinics (4 points | 1 comment)
7. Sayonara, R35: Nissan Japan has stopped taking orders for the GT-R (11 points | 5 comments)
8. Cognitive Behaviors That Enable Self-Improving Reasoners (195 points | 60 comments)
9. Game Theory and Settling the Debts of the Deceased in Ancient Times (12 points | 1 comment)
10. GoStringUngarbler: Deobfuscating Strings in Garbled Binaries (16 points | 8 comments)
11. QwQ-32B: Embracing the Power of Reinforcement Learning (390 points | 119 comments)
12. Empirical Health is hiring design engineers to build primary care of the future ( | hide)
13. Apache iceberg the Hadoop of the modern-data-stack? (62 points | 34 comments)
14. Windows Is Free for Business (2008) (26 points | 37 comments)
15. Automatically tagging politician when they use their phone on the livestreams (214 points | 113 comments)
16. Zentool – AMD Zen Microcode Manipulation Utility (194 points | 52 comments)
17. Tiny Ten DSP-Based HF Transceiver (47 points | 9 comments)
18. Scientists crack how aspirin might stop cancers from spreading (61 points | 21 comments)
19. HYTRADBOI 2025 Conference Postmortem (56 points | 5 comments)
20. Apple M3 Ultra (995 points | 934 comments)
21. Yoke: Infrastructure as code, but actually (106 points | 106 comments)
22. Exploring the Paramilitary Leaks (192 points | 113 comments)
23. Nebu: A Spreadsheet Editor for Varvara (105 points | 12 comments)
24. Things we've learned about building products (276 points | 87 comments)
25. Solving First Order Differential Equations with Julia (105 points | 29 comments)
26. Math Academy pulled me out of the Valley of Despair (184 points | 134 comments)
27. Show HN: Beating Pokemon Red with RL and <10M Parameters (156 points | 61 comments)
28. Apple takes UK to court over 'backdoor' order (571 points | 211 comments)
29. Show HN: Leaflet.pub – a web app for creating and sharing rich documents (143 points | 51 comments)
30. The Tiny Star Explosions Powering Moore's Law (110 points | 13 comments)
